description: This notification is generated when the pwOperStatus
object for a pseudowire transitions from up(1) to down(2)
or from down(2) to up(1).
This variable indicates the index of the pseudowire
that either went up, down, or was deleted as reported
by the corresponding notification.
To obtain further information regarding the pseudowire,
the network administrator should look up the corresponding
pseudowire entry in pwTable (RFC 5601).
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationPwIndex

description: This variable is used to report the value of pwOperStatus
in pwTable (RFC 5601) associated with the pseudowire that
went up or down.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationPwOperStatus

description: This notification is generated when a PW has been
deleted.
This variable indicates the index of the pseudowire
that either went up, down, or was deleted as reported
by the corresponding notification.
To obtain further information regarding the pseudowire,
the network administrator should look up the corresponding
pseudowire entry in pwTable (RFC 5601).
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationPwIndex

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationPeerAddr

description: This notification is generated when the mplsTunnelOperStatus
object for a te-lsp transitions from up(1) to down(2)
or from down(2) to up(1). This new state is indicated by the
included value of mplsTunnelOperStatus.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsTunnelStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIndex u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelInstance u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIngressLSRId u 0 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelEgressLSRId u 0 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelAdminStatus i 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelOperStatus i 2

$SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsTunnelStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIndex u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelInstance u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIngressLSRId u 0 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelEgressLSRId u 0 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelAdminStatus i 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelOperStatus i 3

$SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsTunnelStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIndex u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelInstance u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIngressLSRId u 0 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelEgressLSRId u 0 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelAdminStatus i 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelOperStatus i 1

description: Uniquely identifies a set of tunnel instances
between a pair of ingress and egress LSRs.
Contains part of the index of a te tunnel that underwent
state change.
The same tunnel can also be looked up in the te mib.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIndex

description: Uniquely identifies a particular instance of a
tunnel between a pair of ingress and egress LSRs.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelInstance

description: Identity of the ingress LSR associated with this
tunnel instance.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelIngressLSRId

description: Identity of the egress LSR associated with this
tunnel instance.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelEgressLSRId

description: Reports the desired operational status of this tunnel.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelAdminStatus

description: Reports the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifTunnelOperStatus

description: This notification is generated when the value of
'mplsLdpSessionState' (rfc3815) enters or leaves the
'operational(5)' state.

event.Summary: MPLS LDP session state changed to $v4

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsLdpSessionStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityLdpId s EXAMPL EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityIndex u 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpPeerLdpId s EXAMPL EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionState i 4 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionDiscontinuityTime t 31536000

$SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsLdpSessionStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityLdpId s EXAMPL EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityIndex u 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpPeerLdpId s EXAMPL EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionState i 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionDiscontinuityTime t 31536000

$SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsLdpSessionStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityLdpId s EXAMPL EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityIndex u 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpPeerLdpId s EXAMPL EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionState i 5 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionDiscontinuityTime t 31536000

description: The LDP identifier. This is the primary index to identify
a row in the mplsLdpEntityTable (RFC 3815).
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityLdpId

description: This index is used as a secondary index to uniquely identify
a row in the mplsLdpEntityTable (RFC 3815).
This object is meaningful to some but not all, LDP
implementations.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpEntityIndex

description: The LDP identifier of this LDP Peer.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpPeerLdpId

description: The current state of the session, all of the
states 1 to 5 are based on the state machine
for session negotiation behavior.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionState

description: The initial value of this object is the value of
sysUpTime when the entry was created in this table.
Subsequent notifications report the time when the session
between a given Entity and Peer goes away or a new session
is established.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeMplsNotifLdpSessionDiscontinuityTime

description: This notification is generated to inform recepients of the
state of the Vpls.
When all pseudowires in this Vpls are up or ready and the
attachment circuit is up, extremeVplsNotifStatusOperStatus
is set to vplsOperStatusUp(1) in the notification.
When at least one pseudowire in this Vpls is up or ready
and the attachment circuit is up, extremeVplsNotifStatusOperStatus
is set to vplsOperStatusDegraded(2) in the notification.
When all pseudowires in this Vpls are down or the
attachment circuit is down, extremeVplsNotifStatusOperStatus
is set to vplsOperStatusDown(3) in the notification.
Once a notification has been sent with vplsOperStatusDegraded(2)
no further notification will be sent untill
extremeVplsNotifStatusOperStatus transitions to
vplsOperStatusUp(1) or vplsOperStatusDown(3).
REFERENCE
See also Extreme Networks Concepts Guide for a description of H-VPLS.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigIndex u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigVpnId s EXAMPLE EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigAdminStatus i 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifStatusOperStatus i 2

$SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsStatusChange EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigIndex u 9999 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigVpnId s EXAMPLE EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigAdminStatus i 1 EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifStatusOperStatus i 1

description: Unique index for the conceptual row identifying
a VPLS service in the vplsConfigTable.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigIndex

description: This objects indicates the IEEE 802-1990 VPN ID of the
associated VPLS service.
This object has the same value as vplsConfigVpnId in the
vplsConfigTable for an index value equal to
extremeVplsNotifConfigIndex sent in the notification.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigVpnId

description: The administrative state of the VPLS service.
This object has the same value as vplsConfigAdminStatus in the
vplsConfigTable for an index value equal to
extremeVplsNotifConfigIndex sent in the notification.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifConfigAdminStatus

description: The current operational state of this VPLS Service.
A value of up(1) indicates that all pseudo-wires for this
vpls are up and the attachment circuit is up.
A value of degraded(2) indicates that at least one
pseudo-wires for this vpls is up and the attachment circuit
is up.
A value of down(3) indicates that all pseudo-wires for this
vpls are down or the attachment circuit is down.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremeVplsNotifStatusOperStatus

description: This notification is generated when an entry is added to the
extremePwLspOutboundMappingTable table and the extremePwLspPerfTable
table.

event.Summary: Entry added to outbound mapping and LSP performance table

description: This variable indicates the index of the pseudowire
that either went up, down, or was deleted as reported
by the corresponding notification.
To obtain further information regarding the pseudowire,
the network administrator should look up the corresponding
pseudowire entry in pwTable (RFC 5601).
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationPwIndex

description: This variable indicates the index of the LSP
that was added to or deleted from a given PW as reported
by the corresponding notification.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationLspIndex

description: This notification is generated when an entry is deleted from the
extremePwLspOutboundMappingTable table and the extremePwLspPerfTable
table.

event.Summary: Entry deleted from outbound mapping and LSP performance table

description: This variable indicates the index of the pseudowire
that either went up, down, or was deleted as reported
by the corresponding notification.
To obtain further information regarding the pseudowire,
the network administrator should look up the corresponding
pseudowire entry in pwTable (RFC 5601).
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationPwIndex

description: This variable indicates the index of the LSP
that was added to or deleted from a given PW as reported
by the corresponding notification.
variables.name: EXTREME-MPLS-MIB::extremePwNotificationLspIndex
